ab7bd851cc67.title: Lol. So brilliant. On so many levels.

paragraphs.text: Lol. So brilliant. On so many levels.
paragraphs.name: 5b77

paragraphs.text: I fully support this statement. Love is about taking a risk and knowing you will get hurt. The people you love will disappoint you, anger you, and frustrate you. But until one accepts that, he or she will not be able to experience the full high that loving someone (and having someone love you) can provide you.
paragraphs.name: e755

42c4dff149fd.title: So true on the ‘be the first to say hi’.

paragraphs.text: So true on the ‘be the first to say hi’. Only been not ‘hi’d back twice, though, and wriggled past the awkwardness like a missed hi-five
paragraphs.name: ef51

paragraphs.text: Beautifully said, Olivia. I am in complete agreement and I bow to your own journey in learning to love people fully. It sounds like a rewarding one!

paragraphs.text: I can relate. There are definitely awkward interactions (I had one just the other day). Still, I like to think kindness given freely is never a waste of energy. To some, it might be strange and to others, it might make there day. We just never know!
paragraphs.name: f574

paragraphs.text: 5. Kiss him. Kiss her. What, you think Eros is flying around like a crazed cupid shooting you in the butt for fun? It’s his job, people. Help him out. Love is always worth the pain. (And I know — those arrows are sharp.)
paragraphs.name: 19ec

paragraphs.text: 5. Kiss him. Kiss her. What, you think Eros is flying around like a crazed cupid shooting you in the butt for fun? It’s his job, people. Help him out. Love is always worth the pain. (And I know — those arrows are sharp.)
